application.doc: Adding an address to an interface

param.name: interface_id
param.doc: ID of the application interface. Valid values are P.1, P.2, P.3, and P.4.

param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: POST
method.id: Adding an address to an interface
method.doc: To add an address to an interface with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP POST command on the application interface addresses resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Indicates whether the address is enabled. Valid value is "true" or "false".

param.name: mode4
param.doc: Indicates whether the IPv4 address is static or DHCP-assigned. This parameter is required if type is set to ipv4. Valid value is "static" or "auto". Note: Only 1 address per interface can be auto. All others must be static.

param.name: address
param.doc: If the address is IPv6 or the mode4 parameter is set to static, this field contains the IP address. If the mode4 parameter is set to auto, this field is ignored. This parameter is optional. If no value is specified, the current value remains. If the current value of the mode4 parameter is changed from auto to static, this parameter is required.

param.name: netmask
param.doc: This field contains the IPv4 subnet mask. If the mode4 parameter is set to auto, this field is ignored. If no value is specified, the current value remains. If the current value of the mode4 parameter is changed from auto to static, this parameter is required.

param.name: type
param.doc: Valid value is "ipv4" or "ipv6".

param.name: prefix
param.doc: This parameter is the IPv6 prefix. This parameter is optional.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting
